DOC.brief_summary: Approximately one third child adolescent United States either overweight obese . Childhood obesity disproportionately affect specific racial ethnic group household low socioeconomic status low parental education . The Alternative Learning Center ( ALC ) within Rochester School District 535 provide viable educational option student experience difficulty regular educational system . A great proportion student ALC minority , qualify free reduce lunch receive special education service . These child likely unique barrier physical activity healthy eating . Specific Aims : Aim 1 : Examine association BMI ethnic/ socioeconomic variable behavior related physical activity eat ALC student . Aim 2 : Develop age culturally appropriate on-site program promotes healthy lifestyle .
DOC.brief_title: Development Youth Healthy Living Program With Underserved Adolescents Rochester Alternative Learning Center
DOC.detailed_description: Investigators assess relationship BMI ethnicity , socioeconomic variable behavior related nutrition physical activity among 200 ALC student . Investigators also conduct 6 gender stratify ( 3 boy , 3 girl ) focus group student ( n=24 ) , 3 focus group parent ( n=24 ) one focus group staff volunteer order understand perceive barrier towards healthy weight/nutrition/physical activity . Investigators utilize information co-develop healthy living program ALC . Investigators finally test feasibility program develop period 3 month ALC student . Study finding inform research test efficacy validity program develop ALC subsequent school base trial future goal obtain funding cluster randomize control trial among school region .
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criterion : Rochester Alternative Learning Center student age 12 year 20 year Parents/guardians ALC student ALC staff . Exclusion criterion : Inability assent consent participate study .
